page.title: 18INDUSTRY:GAS AND COAL.
page.content: {Colin Oddy age 11 {Coventry Gas Works}are in{Judds Lane} between{Longford}and{Holbrooks}.For most of this century{gas}was made from{coal}and kept in large{gas {holders.}What{coal}was left over was used to keep families warm and as tar to make roads.In the 1960's {natural gas}was found under the North Sea and brought in pipes to{Coventry. Sometimes the{gas holders}are high, sometimes they are lower.The{Coventry {colliery marshalling yards and sidings are behind{Bedlam Lane.}The{coal}comes from{Coventry Colliery}at{Keresley}on a mineral line used for{coal.}The full trucks are kept waiting until a train can be made up.The trains move on the main line running to Nuneaton.The trucks are moved with small yellow diesel engines before forming a new train.
